text:
Hallo,

I installed newest Apache 2.2.6 with pgp 5.2.4, and svn 1.4.5 under Windows.
apache says that modules mod_dav_svn.so and mod_authz_svn.so has wrong version
and libdb43.dll not found - then the name is modified by svn to libdb44.dll.
I renamed libdb44 to libdb43 - it is ok but i can nothing do with the .so files
:-( I tried it to patch binary but more as one thing is checked - (firstly any
signature and later the version...)

If the version 2.2.6 is an security update only than is the check of
compatibility for .so modules too strong, I think...

Excuse me my weak english :-)

Kovács András
creator: kova63@freemail.hu

text:
I guess the svn module is not compiled against 2.2.x. Please use a svn module
that is compiled against 2.2.x.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Thanks.
I have downloaded and installed svn "Win32 packages built against Apache 2.2".
It is possible that the version checking is strong but "against Apache 2.2"
means all versions after 2.2 or 2.2.x.
Maybe version checking must be exact - developer of svn must be compile new .so
modules for all new apache versions, also for "only security updates".

Unfortunately the actual version of apache 2.2.6 svn 1.4.5 and php 5.2.4 remain
incompatible at this time.
creator: kova63@freemail.hu

text:
Ok. Then I guess it is something different, because the checking is only on
2.2.x not on a specific release of 2.2.x. All 2.2.x releases are binary compatible.
Have you tried PHP and SVN independently?
creator: rpluem@apache.org
kova63@freemail.hu
text:
Yes, svn works standalone but without webdav.
Apache works - I get 'It works  :-). 
PHP with Apache I not tested yet, but I think it would be work.

I try it do describe exactly what I have doing:

Installed on Windows 2000Prof SP4 HUN
- svn 1.4.5      2007.Sep.06
- Apache 2.2.6   2007.Sep.29 22:17 
- php 4.2.4      2007.Sep.29 23:02

relevant lines in httpd.conf:

1.) LoadModule dav_module modules/mod_dav.so
2.) LoadModule dav_fs_module modules/mod_dav_fs.so
...
3.) LoadModule dav_svn_module modules/mod_dav_svn.so
4.) LoadModule authz_svn_module modules/mod_authz_svn.so

#BEGIN PHP INSTALLER EDITS - REMOVE ONLY ON UNINSTALL
5.) LoadModule php5_module "D:/DEWEB/php/php5apache2_2.dll"
6.) PHPIniDir "D:/DEWEB/php/"
#END PHP INSTALLER EDITS - REMOVE ONLY ON UNINSTALL

Files:
mod_dav_svn.so 
mod_authz_svn.so
copied from svn directory to modules directory of apache
File:
libdb44 
copied from svn directory to bin directory of apache

Start apache firstly result error:

httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 115 of D:/DEWEB/apache/conf/httpd.conf: AP
le structure 'dav_svn_module' in file D:/DEWEB/apache/modules/mod_dav_svn.
garbled - expected signature 41503232 but saw 41503230 - perhaps this is n
Apache module DSO, or was compiled for a different Apache version?
Note the errors or messages above, and press the <ESC> key to exit.  20...


After hex patched signature in one of .so files 41503230 -> 41503232 error:

httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 115 of D:/DEWEB/apache/conf/httpd.conf: Module
C:\\Projects\\subversion-1.4.5\\subversion\\mod_dav_svn\\mod_dav_svn.c" is not
ompatible with this version of Apache (found 20020903, need 20051115). Please
ntact the vendor for the correct version.
Note the errors or messages above, and press the <ESC> key to exit.  2....14..

Comment out lines  marked as 3.) and 4.) in httpd.conf

result 2 times error: libdb34.dll not found 
click 2 times Ok than apache starts

Rename libdb44.dll to libdb43.dll in D:\DEWEB\apache\bin 
apache stop and start again reports no more error.
Apache with php starts but without webdav :-(

Thats all what I know.
I can't build the right .so files for svn under Windows :'-(

creator: kova63@freemail.hu
text: Excuse me I must correct - I Installed PHP 5.2.4 (not 4.2.4).

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Your mod_dav_svn.so is compiled against httpd 2.0.x and NOT against 2.2.x. This
is proven by the error messages (expected signature 41503232 but saw 41503230 /
found 20020903, need 20051115). Please get a version of mod_dav_svn.so that is
compiled against 2.2.x.

creator: kova63@freemail.hu
text:
Sorry, you have right, the bug was I itself :-(

I must strew ashtray on my head.

I Thank you all that you help me to find out what I made wrong.

I searched the svn version for Apache 2.2.x and fount only the install zip
package not the program, but I remembered, that I used the install programm .msi
but it exists on svn homepage only for 2.0.x !

I downloaded both I  remebered I have version for 2.2.x and oversight that only
the zipped version is for 2.2.x...

Now I have overwrite the installation, and the .so files with the zippped svn,
only the libdb44 must be renamed to libdb43 and it works !

Great thanks for you, for your patience with me apologise for my mistake and my
weak english.
